intro: Gilia achilleifolia var. chamissonis, commonly known as the Chamisson's gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bright pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This variant is distinguished by its slightly different floral structure and habitat preferences compared to the typical form of Gilia achilleifolia.
